For the second quarter of 2022, UMC reported revenue of NT$72 billion, reflecting a quarter-over-quarter (QoQ) growth of 13.6% compared to the first quarter of 2022. Year-over-year (YoY), the revenue for the first half of 2022 increased by 38.2%, reaching NT$135.4 billion.

In terms of profitability, UMC achieved a net income of NT$21.5 billion for Q2 2022, with earnings per share (EPS) of 1.74, up from 1.61 in Q1 2022 and 0.98 in Q2 2021. The gross margin improved to 46.5% from 43.4% in the previous quarter, and the operating income was NT$28.1 billion, representing an operating margin of 39.1%.

The revenue growth was driven by several factors, including increased average selling prices (ASP), higher wafer shipment volumes, and the depreciation of the NT dollar. The company also benefited from new capacity coming online, which contributed to the revenue increase.

Looking forward, UMC expects only a minor increase in ordering capacity for Q3 2022. The company's strategic focus on capacity expansion is reflected in its capital expenditures, which are projected to remain around NT$3.6 billion for the year, primarily allocated to capacity-related expansion.
